programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Forbidden Caves: Could Earth's deepest caves hide secret conduits to other worlds? Or harbour evidence that aliens once visited our planet? Experts investigate. (S7, ep 3)

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Aliens Among Us: Are we being watched by otherworldly beings? Experts make surprising discoveries as they explore the ancient past for evidence of alien overseers. (S7, ep 4)

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The Genius Factor: History's greatest geniuses have often said their ideas came from visions or hallucinations. But could they have come from aliens? Experts investigate. (S7, ep 5)

programme.title: Close Encounters Down Under

programme.title: Cutty Sark: Out of the Ashes
programme.desc: Ben Fogle steps aboard the iconic tea clipper on her 140th anniversary to examine the full story of the world-famous ship and the desperate attempts to save her from the scrap yard.

programme.title: Swamp Ghost: WWII Plane Rescue
programme.desc: Documentary lifting the lid on the story of Alfred Hagen and his expedition to discover and rescue The Swamp Ghost, a WWII B-17 Bomber that crashed in Papua New Guinea.

programme.title: Weird Or What? With William Shatner

programme.title: Weird Or What? With William Shatner

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Mind Control: From the Cold War to the TV set, experts question whether the government is actively controlling what you think, how you act and what you believe. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed

programme.title: Claw Hunters

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Whack Job: The staff are pushed to their breaking point by a customer's endless parade of worthless items. Later, Ashley gets the chance to assert herself. (S3, ep 1)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Family Feud: A difference of opinion threatens to explode into a full-on family feud on a difficult day in the shop. (S3, ep 5)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Battle Bought: Allen and Ton take on an old foe at a container auction to get their hands on a mint 1800s pistol and a collection of 90s remote-controlled combat robots. (S2, ep 23)

programme.title: Auction Hunters

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There

programme.desc: Guns a-Blazin'. The baggage battlers head to a cowboy auction in California, where they duel over items dating back to the legendary Buffalo Bill and the Barnum & Bailey circuses. S3, Ep8

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Platinum Hits. The baggage battlers head to a music icons auction in New York. They find a gold disc for the Pink Floyd album 'Dark Side Of The Moon' and a nude photo of Madonna. S3, Ep9

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: British Catastrophe. When Bobby Cohen spots a rusty British cab at the junkyard, he vows to save it. But his son, Andy, thinks he's crazy and invests in a Lamborghini Murcielago. S4, Ep1

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Fast Times At Junkyard Empire. Andy and Bobby see their employees as family. But can they turn a wrecked K-9 explosives police wagon into a camo-wrapped hunting truck for Tim's son? S4, Ep2

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Junkyard Blitz. When Andy tries to convert an old Dodge pick-up into a vintage Power Wagon, Bobby goes crazy. Then Andy buys a German military truck for a crazy advertising scheme. S4, Ep3

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Old Mustang, New Muscle. When Andy finds an '85 Mustang SVO, he tries to transplant a modern Ford EcoBoost engine into a car built around an old 2.3-litre motor. S4, Ep4

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: Bobble-Head Ache. The 67 GTO is ready for its debut, but the team isn't sure about Dave's colour choice. Polished panels, custom upholstery and a fierce engine make it stand out. S4, Ep16

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: We Build Kindig Customs. Dave and the team start a one-of-a-kind build they have never attempted before, a 1964 Ranchero. But what there is underneath the metal sets the team back. S5, Ep1

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: 24 Karat Magic. The Ranchero build is an epic achievement for Dave and the team, but will the client see it the same way? And will Dave find the perfect name for the perfect car? S5, Ep2

programme.title: Bad Chad Customs
programme.desc: Chad Vs. Pinto. Chad attempts to transform a rusted-out 1971 Pinto into a European-style performance car. He must overcome a mountain of problems and beat a tight deadline. S1, Ep11

programme.title: Bad Chad Customs
programme.desc: Performance Pinto. The team continues converting the rusted '71 Pinto into a European performance car. Chad presses hard to get his creation ready for its dramatic reveal. S1, Ep15

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: The Search Continues. After coming closer than ever to proving the existence of Bigfoot in Oregon, the team continues their search in the mountains of Kentucky. S2, Ep1

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: (1995) Mel Gibson stars in this Oscar-laden epic as William Wallace - Scottish freedom fighter, rousing orator and keen face painter - who led his army into England, threatening the throne.

programme.title: No Exit
programme.desc: (2022) Thriller. A recovering addict ends up stranded at a remote visitor centre in a snowstorm with four strangers, then finds a kidnapped girl in the car park. Question is: who did it?

programme.title: The Guilty
programme.desc: (2018) Crime drama. Jakob Cedergren stars as a troubled cop, confined to the office, who must race against time to help a distressed woman. In Danish/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Winslow Boy
programme.desc: (1948) Anthony Asquith's drama based on a famous 1912 court case with Cedric Hardwicke as the father of a boy accused of theft who pursues the case to the highest courts. With Robert Donat.

programme.title: The Wrong Box
programme.desc: (1966) Dark comedy with John Mills, Ralph Richardson and Michael Caine. Two brothers clash over money that their parents left to their last surviving child, with chaotic consequences.

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: (1972) Biopic charting the rise of the future PM from battered Harrow pupil to MP via military action on foreign soil. Directed by Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for...
programme.desc: ...Peculiar Children Interview Special: Director Tim Burton and stars Eva Green, Asa Butterfield and Ella Purnell talk about their fantasy adventure, adapted from Ransom Riggs's bestseller.

programme.title: Le Mans '66
programme.desc: (2019) Oscar-winning sports drama starring Matt Damon and Christian Bale. In the 60s, Ford set out to build a car that can defeat Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans race.

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: (2022) Margot Robbie and Brad Pitt star in Damien Chazelle's opulently decadent, satirical look at Hollywood in the 1920s as it teeters between the silent the era and the 'talkies'.

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for...
programme.desc: ...Peculiar Children: (2016) Eva Green and Asa Butterfield star in Tim Burton's fantasy adventure. A teenager enters the magical, but scary and violent, world where his grandfather grew up.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: (1984) Kung fu thriller with Ralph Macchio and Pat Morita. Elderly handyman Mr Miyagi teaches new-kid-at-school Daniel how to stand up to the school bully. It all hinges on the crane kick.

programme.title: The Karate Kid II
programme.desc: (1986) Second instalment of the martial arts franchise with Pat Morita and Ralph Macchio. Mr Miyagi returns home to visit his dying dad. But he has unfinished business...

programme.title: Battleship Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Peter Berg and stars Rihanna, Brooklyn Decker and Taylor Kitsch talk about making the seaborne sci-fi blockbuster Battleship.

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part III
programme.desc: (1989) Ralph Macchio and Pat Morita return as the pupil with problems and the karate teacher who doesn't like fighting. This time, Daniel is tricked into defending his All Valley title.

programme.title: Suffragette Interview Special
programme.desc: Writer Abi Morgan, director Sarah Gavron and star Anne-Marie Duff talk about their powerful period political drama Suffragette.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: (2010) Remake of the classic martial arts film, starring Jackie Chan and Jaden Smith. A caretaker shows an American boy how to stand up to bullies at his new school in Beijing.

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: (2014) Thriller. Denzel Washington stars as an ex-soldier who comes out of retirement to help a teenage sex worker who's been assaulted by her pimp.

programme.title: The Long Good Friday
programme.desc: (1980) Bob Hoskins and Helen Mirren star in John MacKenzie's East London gangster thriller. Gang leader Hoskins' hold over his empire is under threat.

programme.title: Isle of Dogs
programme.desc: (2018) Wes Anderson's animated comedy with Bryan Cranston and Bill Murray. A boy breaks his beloved pet out of doggy exile in a future, dystopian Japan. May not be suitable for young kids.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Muppets from Space
programme.desc: (1999) The Muppets are back in another feature-length adventure as Gonzo, convinced that he is of alien origin, struggles to communicate with his family in outer space.

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: (2004) Quirky high-school comedy starring Jon Heder as a nerdy teenager from an eccentric family, who gains a new-found respect when he organises his friend's student election campaign.

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: (1992) Comedy starring Whoopi Goldberg. A casino singer who witnesses a Mob murder goes into hiding at a convent, where she soon has the choir rocking. With Maggie Smith.

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy sequel starring Whoopi Goldberg and Lauryn Hill. Deloris - who's now made it big in Vegas - goes back undercover as a teacher to help a struggling school choir find its voice.

programme.title: Dog
programme.desc: (2022) Poignant road-trip comedy with Channing Tatum. A soldier with PTSD must escort a traumatised army canine to a comrade's funeral. Can man and dog save each other's lives?

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: (2002) Action-thriller starring Jason Statham. For a price, an underworld courier will deliver people or packages anywhere, no questions asked. But one job lands him in deep danger.

programme.title: Open Range
programme.desc: (2003) Kevin Costner's western with Robert Duvall and Michael Gambon. A small band of free grazers are forced to take on a local rancher and his hired thugs.

programme.desc: (2018) Crime drama. Jakob Cedergren stars as a troubled cop, confined to the office, who must race against time to help a distressed woman. In Danish/subs.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Danube

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Fern meets a German Shorthaired Pointer puppy who has bitten off more than she can chew and helps vet James with Badger, a handsome but nervous cat who is in for a routine vaccination. Fern Britton presents the series where she meets the owners of beloved pets who have appointments at The Grove Vets. In this episode, Fern meets a German Shorthaired Pointer puppy who has bitten off more than she can chew and helps vet James with Badger, a handsome but nervous moggie who is in for a routine vaccination. Cameras also focus on clinical pet behaviourist Rosie Bescoby, who aims to bring harmony to a pair of warring hounds

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: This time, Lawrence and his wife Chanelle from Essex, London sisters Vicky and Nicky, and Newcastle couple Laura and Rob try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Eddie from Chelmsford, Sophie from Bristol, Ariane from Stewarton and Peter from York work together as a team to face one of the country's finest quiz brains. Bradley Walsh asks the questions

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: What's on Scotland
programme.desc: Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: John abruptly ends a call to the helpline, while Bear is left isolated and alone and Jacob blurts out a secret

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: When Aadi falls victim to a robbery at the corner shop, Carla questions Lisa's lack of action. Dev returns home from India, and Ronnie confides in Kevin how Debbie is determined to buy No.6 as she wants to be nearby to support him through his cancer treatment

programme.title: The Road Rage Killer: True Crime Presents
programme.desc: Tracie Andrews purportedly witnesses the murder of her boyfriend Lee Harvey in a country lane in December 1996, but all is not as it seems

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Creed II
programme.desc: Boxing drama starring Michael B Jordan and Sylvester Stallone. Three years after he began training with the legendary Rocky Balboa, Adonis "Donnie" Creed has taken the title of world heavyweight champion. When Russian fighter Viktor Drago, whose father Ivan killed Donnie's dad in the ring decades prior, challenges the young American to a show bout, Donnie and Rocky find their relationship strained. Can the pair work things out? And can Donnie find the inner strength to avenge his father?

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the 13th stage, a 10.9km individual time-trial from Loudenvielle to Peyragudes. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes perfect for al fresco dining, including Cypriot lamb chops, cherry tomato skewers and potato salad. Supper Club host Joseph Denison Carey serves up a tagliatelle, and Ainsley shows guest Dev Griffin how to make sesame and singer seabass with an Asian noodles salad. Olly Smith has canned drinks perfect for the great outdoors

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar's guest is singer Chesney Hawkes, with Shivi serving up smashed breakfast tacos and drinks expert Andy Clarke joins the gang for a tequila tasting. Jimmy checks in on the snakes at the wildlife park to make sure that they're growing properly, and Max McMurdo makes a handy bread-slicing device

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home this time by singer-songwriter Jack Savoretti, Midsomer Murders star Neil Dudgeon, and chefs Glynn Purnell and Sabrina Gidda.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make four mouth-watering dishes with only five main ingredients, starting with a garlic and rosemary focaccia, followed by John's pink spaghetti. Following that are chicken and peanut butter scissor-cut noodles and moreish and fuss-free banana doughnuts.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef returns to Highgrove House in Gloucestershire, the family residence of King Charles and Queen Camilla. Mel takes him around some of their vegetable beds while chatting about how she came to be a gardener for the King, while royal beekeeper Stephen demonstrates the art of managing hives as he and Raymond discuss their shared passion for bees and honey

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Newbury
programme.desc: Oli Bell presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Super Sprint from Newbury, plus racing from Market Rasen and The Curragh. With analysis from Leonna Mayor and Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Matt Chapman, Sally Ann Grassick and Luke Harvey, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Two more of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Toby Anstis, Paula Radcliffe, Rav Wilding and Vanessa Feltz pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. Experts Danni Washington and Tristan Guttridge and shark attack survivor Paul de Gelder are the mentors whose mission is to help the celebrities conquer their fears and teach them to love this notorious predator

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v Germany (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the fourth and concluding quarter-final, held at St. Jakob-Park in Basel, Switzerland. France finished top of Group D after winning all three of their group matches, including a 2-1 victory over holders England. Their opponents finished second in Group C after defeating Poland and Denmark, but suffering a 4-1 defeat at the hands of table-toppers Sweden last time out

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: Hiding in a country cottage, the five suspects attempt to uncover who framed them-or who among them is guilty.

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 14, which consisted of a 182.6km route from Pau to the ski resort of Luchon-Superbagnères. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: As the jury is selected for Kate Lawson's lengthy trial, the Press follows the sensational case of her missing 14-year-old niece Claire Spears, who is presumed murdered. When the jurors meet for the first time, it's clear that this is a diverse group who bring their own problems to the table. Australian courtroom drama, starring Sam Neill and Kate Mulvany

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen

Following that are chicken and peanut butter scissor-cut noodles and moreish and fuss-free banana doughnuts.

programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet and Ian McKellen. Posh rodent Roddy St James leads a sheltered life in a Kensington mansion, with his every need catered for by his wealthy owners. But his life as a pampered pet comes to an end when he's flushed down the toilet to a subterranean world where the population is being threatened by an evil toad.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform a supportive sister, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan to provide the chat this time are Selina Scott, Pixie Lott and Tom Parker-Bowles, and we also meet some rare-breed Guernsey goats with a royal title.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, with celebrity contestants including professional skater Sylvain Longchambon, singer Joe McElderry, and Olympian snowboarder Aimee Fuller competing alongside members of the public. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Robin Williams, Sally Field and Pierce Brosnan. When voiceover artist Daniel Hillard walks out of his day job, his wife Miranda decides it's time to walk out on him, and is granted custody of their children. Daniel is desperate to be with his kids, so when Miranda advertises for a nanny-cum-housekeeper he applies for the job in disguise.

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Barbara Bach. James Bond sets out to stop an evil shipping magnate who is capturing nuclear submarines by means of a secret tracking device. Bond finds help in the unlikely shape of a beautiful KGB agent, and a formidable enemy in steel-toothed killer Jaws.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean travels to Perth and Kinross, visiting Loch of the Lowes Visitor Centre and Wildlife Reserve to learn about the ospreys that return there to mate

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: There is a visit to Dounreay nuclear power plant, Atta Yaqub learns about footballer-turned-writer Neil Paterson, and Jennifer Reoch finds out about the thread industry in Paisley

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Mark Bonnar, Alexandra Burke and Claire Sweeney 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Karen Pirie
programme.desc: Amid societal unrest in 1984, oil heiress Catriona Grant and her son Adam are kidnapped at gunpoint, but after sending two ransom notes the culprits unexpectedly fall silent and the pair are never seen again. When a man's body is discovered 40 years later in a quarry with a piece of evidence connected to the case, DI Karen Pirie is tasked with reopening the case with the first new lead in decades. Return of the crime drama based on the series of novels by Val McDermid, starring Lauren Lyle

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breaking the Silence: Kate's Story
programme.desc: Former MP Kate Kniveton gives a frank and full insight into her experience of being abused and shamed into silence over 10 years by her ex-husband Andrew Griffiths, who was then a Conservative government minister. Kate also meets other high-achieving professional women who were secretly suffering appalling abuse behind closed doors and who, like her, felt there was no way they could escape the relationship. In this powerful documentary for the Exposure strand, Kate also sheds new light on the secretive world of the family court and shows how perpetrators can play the system to continue their abuse and how judges can get it badly wrong when it comes to protecting survivors and their children

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker gets the grilling of a lifetime as he faces questions from autistic and learning-disabled interviewers, asking if he was forced out by the BBC and who the worst person he has worked with is. From the Hand of God to his first love, no question is off the table and no subject out of bounds when it comes to the Assembly's line of enquiry - expect revelations, chaos, and a lot of laughs

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 12, a 180.6km route from Auch to Hautacam. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Peter Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: As the jury is selected for Kate Lawson's lengthy trial, the Press follows the sensational case of her missing 14-year-old niece Claire Spears, who is presumed murdered. programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet and Ian McKellen. Posh rodent Roddy St James leads a sheltered life in a Kensington mansion, with his every need catered for by his wealthy owners. programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire

Daniel is desperate to be with his kids, so when Miranda advertises for a nanny-cum-housekeeper he applies for the job in disguise.

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Barbara Bach. James Bond sets out to stop an evil shipping magnate who is capturing nuclear submarines by means of a secret tracking device. Bond finds help in the unlikely shape of a beautiful KGB agent, and a formidable enemy in steel-toothed killer Jaws.

programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Mark Bonnar, Alexandra Burke and Claire Sweeney 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Karen Pirie
programme.desc: Amid societal unrest in 1984, oil heiress Catriona Grant and her son Adam are kidnapped at gunpoint, but after sending two ransom notes the culprits unexpectedly fall silent and the pair are never seen again. When a man's body is discovered 40 years later in a quarry with a piece of evidence connected to the case, DI Karen Pirie is tasked with reopening the case with the first new lead in decades. Return of the crime drama based on the series of novels by Val McDermid, starring Lauren Lyle

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breaking the Silence: Kate's Story
programme.desc: Former MP Kate Kniveton gives a frank and full insight into her experience of being abused and shamed into silence over 10 years by her ex-husband Andrew Griffiths, who was then a Conservative government minister. Kate also meets other high-achieving professional women who were secretly suffering appalling abuse behind closed doors and who, like her, felt there was no way they could escape the relationship. In this powerful documentary for the Exposure strand, Kate also sheds new light on the secretive world of the family court and shows how perpetrators can play the system to continue their abuse and how judges can get it badly wrong when it comes to protecting survivors and their children

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker gets the grilling of a lifetime as he faces questions from autistic and learning-disabled interviewers, asking if he was forced out by the BBC and who the worst person he has worked with is. From the Hand of God to his first love, no question is off the table and no subject out of bounds when it comes to the Assembly's line of enquiry - expect revelations, chaos, and a lot of laughs

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Danube
programme.desc: The second leg of Joanna's adventure takes her to the landlocked countries of Slovakia and Hungary. She traces Danube tributaries to the top of the dramatic Tatras mountains in Slovakia, explores the river by boat in Budapest, rides a children's railway, and discovers the city's Jewish heritage. The actress and presenter also meets Hungary's cowboys

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: This time, Lawrence and his wife Chanelle from Essex, London sisters Vicky and Nicky, and Newcastle couple Laura and Rob try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: Eddie from Chelmsford, Sophie from Bristol, Ariane from Stewarton and Peter from York work together as a team to face one of the country's finest quiz brains. Bradley Walsh asks the questions

programme.title: What's on Scotland

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: John abruptly ends a call to the helpline, while Bear is left isolated and alone and Jacob blurts out a secret

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: When Aadi falls victim to a robbery at the corner shop, Carla questions Lisa's lack of action. Dev returns home from India, and Ronnie confides in Kevin how Debbie is determined to buy No.6 as she wants to be nearby to support him through his cancer treatment

programme.title: The Road Rage Killer: True Crime Presents
programme.desc: Tracie Andrews purportedly witnesses the murder of her boyfriend Lee Harvey in a country lane in December 1996, but all is not as it seems

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Creed II
programme.desc: Boxing drama starring Michael B Jordan and Sylvester Stallone. Three years after he began training with the legendary Rocky Balboa, Adonis "Donnie" Creed has taken the title of world heavyweight champion. When Russian fighter Viktor Drago, whose father Ivan killed Donnie's dad in the ring decades prior, challenges the young American to a show bout, Donnie and Rocky find their relationship strained. Can the pair work things out? And can Donnie find the inner strength to avenge his father?

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the 13th stage, a 10.9km individual time-trial from Loudenvielle to Peyragudes. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes perfect for al fresco dining, including Cypriot lamb chops, cherry tomato skewers and potato salad. Supper Club host Joseph Denison Carey serves up a tagliatelle, and Ainsley shows guest Dev Griffin how to make sesame and singer seabass with an Asian noodles salad. Olly Smith has canned drinks perfect for the great outdoors

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar's guest is singer Chesney Hawkes, with Shivi serving up smashed breakfast tacos and drinks expert Andy Clarke joins the gang for a tequila tasting. Jimmy checks in on the snakes at the wildlife park to make sure that they're growing properly, and Max McMurdo makes a handy bread-slicing device

programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home this time by singer-songwriter Jack Savoretti, Midsomer Murders star Neil Dudgeon, and chefs Glynn Purnell and Sabrina Gidda.

programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make four mouth-watering dishes with only five main ingredients, starting with a garlic and rosemary focaccia, followed by John's pink spaghetti. programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef returns to Highgrove House in Gloucestershire, the family residence of King Charles and Queen Camilla. programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Two more of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Toby Anstis, Paula Radcliffe, Rav Wilding and Vanessa Feltz pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v Germany (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the fourth and concluding quarter-final, held at St. Jakob-Park in Basel, Switzerland. France finished top of Group D after winning all three of their group matches, including a 2-1 victory over holders England. Their opponents finished second in Group C after defeating Poland and Denmark, but suffering a 4-1 defeat at the hands of table-toppers Sweden last time out

programme.desc: Two more of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Toby Anstis, Paula Radcliffe, Rav Wilding and Vanessa Feltz pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. Experts Danni Washington and Tristan Guttridge and shark attack survivor Paul de Gelder are the mentors whose mission is to help the celebrities conquer their fears and teach them to love this notorious predator

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v Germany (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the fourth and concluding quarter-final, held at St. Jakob-Park in Basel, Switzerland. France finished top of Group D after winning all three of their group matches, including a 2-1 victory over holders England. Their opponents finished second in Group C after defeating Poland and Denmark, but suffering a 4-1 defeat at the hands of table-toppers Sweden last time out

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: Hiding in a country cottage, the five suspects attempt to uncover who framed them-or who among them is guilty.

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 14, which consisted of a 182.6km route from Pau to the ski resort of Luchon-Superbagnères. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: As the jury is selected for Kate Lawson's lengthy trial, the Press follows the sensational case of her missing 14-year-old niece Claire Spears, who is presumed murdered. When the jurors meet for the first time, it's clear that this is a diverse group who bring their own problems to the table. Australian courtroom drama, starring Sam Neill and Kate Mulvany

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. Experts Danni Washington and Tristan Guttridge and shark attack survivor Paul de Gelder are the mentors whose mission is to help the celebrities conquer their fears and teach them to love this notorious predator

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make four mouth-watering dishes with only five main ingredients, starting with a garlic and rosemary focaccia, followed by John's pink spaghetti. Following that are chicken and peanut butter scissor-cut noodles and moreish and fuss-free banana doughnuts.

programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet and Ian McKellen. Posh rodent Roddy St James leads a sheltered life in a Kensington mansion, with his every need catered for by his wealthy owners. But his life as a pampered pet comes to an end when he's flushed down the toilet to a subterranean world where the population is being threatened by an evil toad.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform a supportive sister, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan to provide the chat this time are Selina Scott, Pixie Lott and Tom Parker-Bowles, and we also meet some rare-breed Guernsey goats with a royal title.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, with celebrity contestants including professional skater Sylvain Longchambon, singer Joe McElderry, and Olympian snowboarder Aimee Fuller competing alongside members of the public. Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Robin Williams, Sally Field and Pierce Brosnan. When voiceover artist Daniel Hillard walks out of his day job, his wife Miranda decides it's time to walk out on him, and is granted custody of their children. Daniel is desperate to be with his kids, so when Miranda advertises for a nanny-cum-housekeeper he applies for the job in disguise.

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Barbara Bach. James Bond sets out to stop an evil shipping magnate who is capturing nuclear submarines by means of a secret tracking device. Bond finds help in the unlikely shape of a beautiful KGB agent, and a formidable enemy in steel-toothed killer Jaws.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean travels to Perth and Kinross, visiting Loch of the Lowes Visitor Centre and Wildlife Reserve to learn about the ospreys that return there to mate

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: There is a visit to Dounreay nuclear power plant, Atta Yaqub learns about footballer-turned-writer Neil Paterson, and Jennifer Reoch finds out about the thread industry in Paisley

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Mark Bonnar, Alexandra Burke and Claire Sweeney 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Karen Pirie
programme.desc: Amid societal unrest in 1984, oil heiress Catriona Grant and her son Adam are kidnapped at gunpoint, but after sending two ransom notes the culprits unexpectedly fall silent and the pair are never seen again. When a man's body is discovered 40 years later in a quarry with a piece of evidence connected to the case, DI Karen Pirie is tasked with reopening the case with the first new lead in decades. Return of the crime drama based on the series of novels by Val McDermid, starring Lauren Lyle

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breaking the Silence: Kate's Story
programme.desc: Former MP Kate Kniveton gives a frank and full insight into her experience of being abused and shamed into silence over 10 years by her ex-husband Andrew Griffiths, who was then a Conservative government minister. Kate also meets other high-achieving professional women who were secretly suffering appalling abuse behind closed doors and who, like her, felt there was no way they could escape the relationship. In this powerful documentary for the Exposure strand, Kate also sheds new light on the secretive world of the family court and shows how perpetrators can play the system to continue their abuse and how judges can get it badly wrong when it comes to protecting survivors and their children

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker gets the grilling of a lifetime as he faces questions from autistic and learning-disabled interviewers, asking if he was forced out by the BBC and who the worst person he has worked with is. From the Hand of God to his first love, no question is off the table and no subject out of bounds when it comes to the Assembly's line of enquiry - expect revelations, chaos, and a lot of laughs
